cluster.modal_host_tip: Please enter the IP or domain name
cluster.modal_verify_tooltip: When using self - signed HTTPS certificates, certificate verification can be disabled.
cluster.name: name

indices.create_index_fail_reason: Failed to create the index. The reason is: {reason}.
indices.name_convention_tip: Name doesn't match index naming convention.
indices.metrics_tip: Array of metric sub-fields to store.You must specify at least one value.
indices.default_metric_tip: Default metric sub-field to use for queries, scripts, and aggregations that don't use a sub-field. Must be a value from the metrics array.
indices.time_series_metric_tip: Marks the field as a time series metric. The value is the metric type.
indices.alias_path_tip: The path to the target field. Note that this must be the full path, including any parent objects.
indices.doc_values_tip: Should the field be stored on disk in a column-stride fashion, so that it can later be used for sorting, aggregations, or scripting?
indices.store_tip: Whether the field value should be stored and retrievable separately from the _source field?
indices.ignore_malformed_tip: Trying to index the wrong data type into a field throws an exception by default, and rejects the whole document. If this parameter is set to true, it allows the exception to be ignored. The malformed field is not indexed, but other fields in the document are processed normally.Note that this cannot be set if the script parameter is used.
indices.parameter_index_tip: Should the field be quickly searchable?
indices.null_value_tip: The value is substituted for any explicit null values.Note that this cannot be set if the script parameter is used.
indices.script_tip: If this parameter is set, then the field will index values generated by this script, rather than reading the values directly from the source. If a value is set for this field on the input document, then the document will be rejected with an error.
indices.on_script_error_tip: Defines what to do if the script defined by the script parameter throws an error at indexing time.
indices.time_series_dimension_tip: Marks the field as a time series dimension.The doc_values and index mapping parameters must be true.
indices.analyzer_tip: The index analyzer to use, defaults to simple.
indices.search_analyzer_tip: The search analyzer to use, defaults to value of analyzer.
indices.completion_preserve_separators_tip: Preserves the separators, defaults to true.
indices.completion_preserve_position_increments_: Enables position increments, defaults to true.
indices.completion_max_input_length_tip: Limits the length of a single input, defaults to 50 UTF-16 code points.
indices.date_format_tip: The date format(s) that can be parsed.
indices.locale_tip: The locale to use when parsing dates since months do not have the same names and/or abbreviations in all languages.
indices.param_index_knn_tip: If true, you can search this field using the kNN search API.
indices.element_type_tip: The data type used to encode vectors.
indices.dims_tip: Number of vector dimensions. Can't exceed 4096. If dims is not specified, it will be set to the length of the first vector added to the field.
indices.similarity_tip: The vector similarity metric to use in kNN search. Documents are ranked by their vector fieldâ€™s similarity to the query vector.
indices.index_options_tip: An optional section that configures the kNN indexing algorithm.
indices.index_options_type_tip: The type of kNN algorithm to use.
indices.index_options_m_tip: The number of neighbors each node will be connected to in the HNSW graph.
indices.index_options_ef_construction_tip: The number of candidates to track while assembling the list of nearest neighbors for each new node.
indices.index_options_confidence_interval_tip: Only applicable to int8_hnsw, int4_hnsw, int8_flat, and int4_flat index types. The confidence interval to use when quantizing the vectors.
indices.depth_limit_tip: The maximum allowed depth of the flattened object field, in terms of nested inner objects.
indices.eager_global_ordinals_tip: Should global ordinals be loaded eagerly on refresh?
indices.flattened_null_value_tip: A string value which is substituted for any explicit null values within the flattened object field.
indices.ignore_above_tip: Leaf values longer than this limit will not be indexed. By default, there is no limit and all values will be indexed.
indices.split_queries_on_whitespace_tip: Whether full text queries should split the input on whitespace when building a query for this field.
indices.time_series_dimensions_tip: A list of fields inside the flattened object, where each field is a dimension of the time series.(Separate multiple fields with commas)
indices.geo_point_ignore_malformed_tip: If true, malformed geopoints are ignored. If false (default), malformed geopoints throw an exception and reject the whole document.
indices.ignore_z_value_tip: If true (default) three dimension points will be accepted (stored in source) but only latitude and longitude values will be indexed; the third dimension is ignored. If false, geopoints containing any more than latitude and longitude (two dimensions) values throw an exception and reject the whole document.
indices.geo_point_null_value_tip: Accepts an geopoint value which is substituted for any explicit null values.
